info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 11:52AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pecos and southeastern Reeves Counties through 1230 PM CDT... At 1151 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles east of Saragosa, or 30 miles south of Pecos, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Pecos and southeastern Reeves Counties. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 221 and 239. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
